job_title: Registrar Assistant in Johnson City, TN
pros: Great people, a beautiful environment, interesting history, and a culture that promotes spiritual growth and professional development.  Perhaps I am a bit biased, since this is my alma mater, but I would not be opposed to returning to Milligan some day.
cons: Since it is somewhat hidden in the mountains of Tennessee, exposure can be an issue.Also, constant growth means that sometimes construction can make getting around campus somewhat inconvenient.

review_title: I have thoroughly enjoyed the opportunity I've had to work at Milligan College.
job_title: Business Office Mailroom Clerk in Johnson City, TN
pros: One of the best reasons I enjoy working at Milligan is because of their work-study option. I get to work for Milligan College while also studying at the school.  Depending on how much I want to earn towards my tuition, I can decide where my money goes, whether it's towards tuition or direct deposit to my checking account.
cons: I cannot really think of a specific challenge or difficulty of working at Milligan College.

review_title: incestuous mediocrity as described by best coach at school
cons: professors treat athletes poorly, professors lower grades for athletes when missing school for athletic events, administers will  retro-active pay after coach takes job at another school, administrators back-stab and go behind coaches backs to get dirt, coaches try to purposely get ahead by spreading rumors, people in athletic department keep jobs when they don't do their work or won't work with women's sports ... WARNING: If you are a college athlete who is offered a chance to play sports here, DO NOT GO. Not a safe and good environment even though I've experienced it.
